posts.post_content:
I heard of someone who used this in a Highlander with Thrumming Stone and some other card that let you stack your deck.  
Get thrumming stone out, and WHAM there are all your relentless rats. Ow.  
Imagine this thing with door of destinies. >.<  
Anyways, it needs a higher mana cost, at least. Or give it a number limit (just say "Up to X amount can be in a deck" or something.)

posts.post_content:
Great card, a decent remake of [Plague Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Rats) and the very exclusive card you can have more than four times in a deck aside from ([Snow-covered](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snow-covered)) Basic Lands.  
  
Good-working cards with these gnawers are:  
\* [Thumming Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thumming Stone) for mad chain reactions,   
\* [Desperate Research](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desperate Research) for very cheap card advantage,  
\* [Aether Vial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aether Vial) as first turn drop and to get your rats on the field faster and easily,  
\* [Locket of Yesterdays](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Locket of Yesterdays) to reduce their cost by one - yet that's not the best choice since you can use the aforementioned one-drop and the reduction being conditional.  
If you add a green splash, there are some further nice synergies:   
\* [Bloodbond March](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbond March) for the ultimate reaimation,  
\* [Echoing Courage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Echoing Courage) for a cheap +2/+2 boost - at instant speed, a possible reason why you could consider playing this card - although a normal rat will do better if yo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Great card, a decent remake of Plague Rats and the very exclusive card you can have more than four times in a deck aside from (Snow-covered) Basic Lands.

Good-working cards with these gnawers are:
* Thumming Stone for mad chain reactions,
* Desperate Research for very cheap card advantage,
* Aether Vial as first turn drop and to get your rats on the field faster and easily,
* Locket of Yesterdays to reduce their cost by one - yet that's not the best choice since you can use the aforementioned one-drop and the reduction being conditional.
If you add a green splash, there are some further nice synergies:
* Bloodbond March for the ultimate reaimation,
* Echoing Courage for a cheap +2/+2 boost - at instant speed, a possible reason why you could consider playing this card - although a normal rat will do better if yo... (see all)
